what: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
title: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
text: üöß  First warning! notaurin package affiliated AURIN. üöß  üöß  Second warning! old aurin package also affiliated AURIN retiring CRAN 26th May 2022 per AURIN‚Äôs request. However, new notaurin package make way CRAN make sure transition unintrusive possible üöß goal notaurin provide easy way R users access 5000 OPEN DATASETS AURIN using API. can request FREE API key : https://aurin.org.au/resources/aurin-apis/sign-/ AURIN ‚ÄúAustralia‚Äôs :kangaroo: single largest resource accessing clean, integrated, spatially enabled research-ready data issues surrounding health wellbeing, socio-economic metrics, transportation, land-use.‚Äù

title: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
text: ways can install notaurin: package requires sf package. Please see sf package‚Äôs GitHub page install non R dependencies.
code: # from CRAN for the latest version install.packages("notaurin") # from GitHub for the latest development version install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("asiripanich/notaurin")

title: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
text: Let‚Äôs recreate AURIN API R example using notaurin. First, must add AURIN API username password R environment variable .Renviron file. notaurin provides aur_register() function help step. choose set add_to_renviron = TRUE won‚Äôt need run step current machine restart R session. aur_browse() opens data catalogue AURIN default browser. Identify ‚ÄòAURIN Open API ID‚Äô field ‚ÄòAdditional Info‚Äô table dataset want download. example, public toilet 2017 dataset ‚ÄòAURIN Open API ID‚Äô field "aurin:datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB_public_toilets". Note , datasets AURIN may ‚ÄòAURIN Open API ID‚Äô, meaning downloaded via API. Alternatively, may use aur_meta search datasets without leaving R console. Use aur_get() download dataset. Let‚Äôs visualise data using ggplot2 package.  See find available datasets.
code: library(notaurin)  # add_to_renviron = TRUE, so you won't need to run this step again on current machine. aur_register(username = "your-username", password = "your-password", add_to_renviron = T) aur_browse() meta <- aur_meta() #> ‚Ñπ Creating AURIN WFS Client... #> Loading ISO 19139 XML schemas... #> Loading ISO 19115 codelists... #> Loading IANA mime types... #> No encoding supplied: defaulting to UTF-8. #> ‚Ñπ Fetching available datasets... # print out the first five rows knitr::kable(head(meta)) # download this public toilet dataset. open_api_id <- "aurin:datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB_public_toilets" public_toilets <- aur_get(open_api_id = open_api_id) #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'aurin:datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB_public_toilets'... #> ‚úî Finished! state_polygons <- aur_get(open_api_id = "aurin:datasource-AU_Govt_ABS-UoM_AURIN_DB_GeoLevel_ste_2016_aust") #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'aurin:datasource-AU_Govt_ABS-UoM_AURIN_DB_GeoLevel_ste_2016_aust'... #> ‚úî Finished! state_polygons <- state_polygons[state_polygons$state_code_2016 %in% 1:8, ] # If you don't have the package you can install it with `install.packages("ggplot2")`. library(ggplot2) ggplot(public_toilets) +   geom_sf(data = state_polygons, fill = "antiquewhite") +   geom_sf(alpha = 0.05, aes(color = status)) +   labs(title = "Public toilets in Australia, 2017") +   scale_color_brewer(palette = "Dark2") +   theme_bw() +   guides(colour = guide_legend(override.aes = list(alpha = 1))) +   theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "aliceblue"))

title: Access Datasets from the AURIN API
text: many datasets need download, may want put CPUs work. code chucks show can download multiple datasets parallel using {furrr} {future} packages. First, setup workers - affects many datasets can download parallel time. maximum number workers machine can determined using future::availableCores(). Let‚Äôs assume want first 10 rows datasets AURIN word ‚Äútoilet‚Äù title. Extract AURIN open API ids download parallel.
code: library(furrr) #> Loading required package: future library(future) future::plan(future::multiprocess, workers = 2) #> Warning: Strategy 'multiprocess' is deprecated in future (>= 1.20.0). Instead, #> explicitly specify either 'multisession' or 'multicore'. In the current R #> session, 'multiprocess' equals 'multicore'. knitr::kable(meta[grepl("toilet", meta$title, ignore.case = T), ]) toilet_datasets_ids <- meta$aurin_open_api_id[grepl("toilet", meta$title, ignore.case = T)] data_lst <- furrr::future_map(toilet_datasets_ids, ~ aur_get(.x, params = list(maxFeatures = 10))) #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'aurin:datasource-AU_Govt_DSS-UoM_AURIN_national_public_toilets_2017'... #> ‚úî Finished! #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'aurin:datasource-AU_Govt_Doh-UoM_AURIN_DB_national_toilet_map_2018_06'... #> ‚úî Finished! #> ‚Ñπ Downloading 'aurin:datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB_public_toilets'... #> ‚úî Finished! data_lst #> [[1]] #> Simple feature collection with 10 features and 46 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 115.811 ymin: -38.1744 xmax: 153.1177 ymax: -27.9314 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 10 √ó 47 #>    id     toilet_id url   name  address1 town  state postcode address_note male  #>    <chr>      <int> <chr> <chr> <chr>    <chr> <chr>    <int> <chr>        <lgl> #>  1 datas‚Ä¶       341 http‚Ä¶ Elsi‚Ä¶ Alden S‚Ä¶ Clif‚Ä¶ Quee‚Ä¶     4361 <NA>         TRUE  #>  2 datas‚Ä¶       418 http‚Ä¶ Luck‚Ä¶ Lucky B‚Ä¶ Luck‚Ä¶ Sout‚Ä¶     5602 <NA>         TRUE  #>  3 datas‚Ä¶       634 http‚Ä¶ Olds‚Ä¶ Holley ‚Ä¶ Mort‚Ä¶ New ‚Ä¶     2223 <NA>         TRUE  #>  4 datas‚Ä¶      1150 http‚Ä¶ Jaeg‚Ä¶ Hill St‚Ä¶ Oran‚Ä¶ New ‚Ä¶     2800 <NA>         TRUE  #>  5 datas‚Ä¶      1207 http‚Ä¶ Lake‚Ä¶ Evans S‚Ä¶ Shen‚Ä¶ West‚Ä¶     6008 <NA>         FALSE #>  6 datas‚Ä¶      1535 http‚Ä¶ Earl‚Ä¶ Earl St‚Ä¶ Coff‚Ä¶ New ‚Ä¶     2450 <NA>         TRUE  #>  7 datas‚Ä¶      1590 http‚Ä¶ Truc‚Ä¶ Davidso‚Ä¶ Deni‚Ä¶ New ‚Ä¶     2710 <NA>         TRUE  #>  8 datas‚Ä¶      1913 http‚Ä¶ Hemi‚Ä¶ High St‚Ä¶ Belm‚Ä¶ Vict‚Ä¶     3216 <NA>         TRUE  #>  9 datas‚Ä¶      2081 http‚Ä¶ Eden‚Ä¶ Eden Va‚Ä¶ Keyn‚Ä¶ Sout‚Ä¶     5353 The toilet ‚Ä¶ TRUE  #> 10 datas‚Ä¶      2377 http‚Ä¶ Wils‚Ä¶ Wilson ‚Ä¶ Watt‚Ä¶ Vict‚Ä¶     3096 <NA>         TRUE  #> # ‚Ä¶ with 37 more variables: female <lgl>, unisex <lgl>, dump_point <lgl>, #> #   facility_type <chr>, toilet_type <chr>, access_limited <lgl>, #> #   payment_required <lgl>, key_required <lgl>, access_note <chr>, #> #   parking <lgl>, parking_note <chr>, accessible_male <lgl>, #> #   accessible_female <lgl>, accessible_unisex <lgl>, accessible_note <chr>, #> #   mlak <lgl>, parking_accessible <lgl>, access_parking_note <chr>, #> #   ambulant <lgl>, lh_transfer <lgl>, rh_transfer <lgl>, adult_change <lgl>, ‚Ä¶ #>  #> [[2]] #> Simple feature collection with 10 features and 47 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 115.8314 ymin: -36.7422 xmax: 153.2881 ymax: -26.6443 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 10 √ó 48 #>    id     toilet_id url   name  address1 town  state postcode address_note male  #>    <chr>      <int> <chr> <chr> <chr>    <chr> <chr>    <int> <chr>        <lgl> #>  1 datas‚Ä¶       272 http‚Ä¶ Bris‚Ä¶ Brisban‚Ä¶ Merr‚Ä¶ New ‚Ä¶     2329 <NA>         TRUE  #>  2 datas‚Ä¶       578 http‚Ä¶ Nati‚Ä¶ Wimmera‚Ä¶ Nati‚Ä¶ Vict‚Ä¶     3409 <NA>         TRUE  #>  3 datas‚Ä¶       628 http‚Ä¶ Brid‚Ä¶ Bridge ‚Ä¶ Pens‚Ä¶ New ‚Ä¶     2222 <NA>         TRUE  #>  4 datas‚Ä¶       868 http‚Ä¶ Sand‚Ä¶ Oroya S‚Ä¶ Sand‚Ä¶ West‚Ä¶     6639 <NA>         TRUE  #>  5 datas‚Ä¶      1300 http‚Ä¶ Murr‚Ä¶ Ravensw‚Ä¶ Rave‚Ä¶ West‚Ä¶     6208 <NA>         TRUE  #>  6 datas‚Ä¶      1461 http‚Ä¶ Menz‚Ä¶ Purslow‚Ä¶ Moun‚Ä¶ West‚Ä¶     6016 <NA>         TRUE  #>  7 datas‚Ä¶      1638 http‚Ä¶ Roy ‚Ä¶ Warrego‚Ä¶ Dula‚Ä¶ Quee‚Ä¶     4425 <NA>         TRUE  #>  8 datas‚Ä¶      1750 http‚Ä¶ Meri‚Ä¶ Taggert‚Ä¶ Meri‚Ä¶ Vict‚Ä¶     3496 <NA>         TRUE  #>  9 datas‚Ä¶      2520 http‚Ä¶ Show‚Ä¶ Evans S‚Ä¶ Wang‚Ä¶ Vict‚Ä¶     3677 <NA>         TRUE  #> 10 datas‚Ä¶      2725 http‚Ä¶ Haro‚Ä¶ Paxton ‚Ä¶ Clev‚Ä¶ Quee‚Ä¶     4163 <NA>         TRUE  #> # ‚Ä¶ with 38 more variables: female <lgl>, unisex <lgl>, dump_point <lgl>, #> #   facility_type <chr>, toilet_type <chr>, access_limited <lgl>, #> #   payment_required <lgl>, key_required <lgl>, access_note <chr>, #> #   parking <lgl>, parking_note <chr>, accessible_male <lgl>, #> #   accessible_female <lgl>, accessible_unisex <lgl>, accessible_note <chr>, #> #   mlak <lgl>, parking_accessible <lgl>, access_parking_note <chr>, #> #   ambulant <lgl>, lh_transfer <lgl>, rh_transfer <lgl>, adult_change <lgl>, ‚Ä¶ #>  #> [[3]] #> Simple feature collection with 10 features and 39 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 113.7736 ymin: -38.4731 xmax: 151.9332 ymax: -17.5021 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 10 √ó 40 #>    id              ogc_fid status lastupdate name  address1 town  state postcode #>    <chr>             <int> <chr>  <date>     <chr> <chr>    <chr> <chr> <chr>    #>  1 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶      28 Verif‚Ä¶ 2008-02-13 Flyi‚Ä¶ Esplana‚Ä¶ Flyi‚Ä¶ Quee‚Ä¶ 4860     #>  2 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     301 Verif‚Ä¶ 2009-03-25 Tour‚Ä¶ Leslie ‚Ä¶ Stan‚Ä¶ Quee‚Ä¶ 4380     #>  3 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     381 Verif‚Ä¶ 2010-03-24 Pinn‚Ä¶ Day Str‚Ä¶ Pinn‚Ä¶ Sout‚Ä¶ 5304     #>  4 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     500 Verif‚Ä¶ 2008-01-30 Rive‚Ä¶ <NA>     Waik‚Ä¶ Sout‚Ä¶ 5330     #>  5 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     612 Verif‚Ä¶ 2008-02-18 Kend‚Ä¶ <NA>     Kend‚Ä¶ West‚Ä¶ 6323     #>  6 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     620 Verif‚Ä¶ 2006-02-10 Shen‚Ä¶ 124 She‚Ä¶ Menz‚Ä¶ West‚Ä¶ 6436     #>  7 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     673 Verif‚Ä¶ 2008-02-18 Rota‚Ä¶ 1836 No‚Ä¶ Sout‚Ä¶ West‚Ä¶ 6701     #>  8 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     708 Verif‚Ä¶ 2009-02-24 Sand‚Ä¶ Oroya S‚Ä¶ Sand‚Ä¶ West‚Ä¶ 6639     #>  9 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     734 Verif‚Ä¶ 2009-02-18 McIn‚Ä¶ Bent St‚Ä¶ Leon‚Ä¶ Vict‚Ä¶ 3953     #> 10 datasource-UQ_‚Ä¶     847 Verif‚Ä¶ 2008-02-18 Libr‚Ä¶ Civic R‚Ä¶ Aubu‚Ä¶ New ‚Ä¶ 2144     #> # title: Browse AURIN data catalogue. ‚Äî aur_browse
text: convenience function opens AURIN data catelogue default web browser. Use data catalogue select spatial datasets available AURIN. datasets 'AURIN Open API ID' field can downloaded current R session aur_get().

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
text: Query data using WFS getFeature.

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
code: aur_get(open_api_id, crs = "EPSG:4326", params = NULL)  aur_build_request(   open_api_id,   crs = "EPSG:4326",   params = NULL,   outputFormat = "application/json" )

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
text: open_api_id Character. can find layer names AURIN‚Äôs datasets browsing Data Catalogue. layer name found ‚ÄòAURIN Open API ID‚Äô field dataset‚Äôs metadata. crs default "EPSG:4326". Coordinate Reference System wish use params named list contains additional parameters used constructing WFS GetFeature request. useful know ID specific feature maximum number features want query. See examples . outputFormat default "application/json", see https://docs.geoserver.org/latest/en/user/services/wfs/outputformats.html available options.

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
text: sf::sf object.

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
text: aur_build_request() returns URL.

title: Fetch AURIN dataset. ‚Äî aur_get
code: # follow the example in <https://aurin.org.au/resources/aurin-apis/aurin-open-api-and-r/> if (FALSE) { aur_get("aurin:datasource-UQ_ERG-UoM_AURIN_DB_public_toilets")  # Get the first 10 features. aur_get(    open_api_id,    params = list(maxFeatures = 10)  ) }

what: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
title: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
text: Get metadata AURIN datasets

title: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
text: force Logical. Default FALSE. Loading metadata may takes , loaded load unluss force set TRUE.

title: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
text: data.frame two columns -- aurin_open_api_id title.

title: Get metadata of all AURIN datasets ‚Äî aur_meta
code: # this may takes a while to return result. if (FALSE) { aur_meta() }

what: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
title: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
text: function writes AURIN API authentication R environment variable current session. add_to_renviron TRUE, write API .Renviron file AURIN_API_USERPWD.

title: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
code: aur_register(username, password, add_to_renviron = FALSE, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
text: username Character. AURIN API username. password Character. AURIN API password. add_to_renviron Logical. Default FALSE. TRUE file directory authentication file added .Renviron file. overwrite Logical. Default FALSE. TRUE, existing AURIN_API_USERPWD R environment variable replaced new username password.

title: Create an AURIN authentication file. ‚Äî aur_register
Search AURIN API ‚Äî aur_search
text: Search AURIN API

title: Search AURIN API ‚Äî aur_search
text: query character.

title: Search AURIN API ‚Äî aur_search
text: data.frame two columns: aurin_open_api_id, brief_description.

what: notaurin: Access Datasets from the 'AURIN' API ‚Äî notaurin-package
title: notaurin: Access Datasets from the 'AURIN' API ‚Äî notaurin-package
text: 'AURIN' <https://aurin.org.au/resources/aurin-apis/> "Australia's single largest resource accessing clean, integrated, spatially enabled research-ready data issues surrounding health wellbeing, socio-economic metrics, transportation, land-use.". package provides functions download search datasets AURIN API (free use!).
